creditline: Gift of funds from former Board Chairs in honor of John E. Andrus III's 100th birthday
description: kneeling man with long wavy hair and beard, holding drapery around his lower torso and thighs with his PL hand, and flogging himself on the back with a whip in his in PR hand; altar with candles at right
inscription:
Signature, Date and Inscription

on back, in pencil: [M3421-185]
provenance: Probably M. A. McDonald (New York). Sale, Skinner, Boston, March 2, 2007, no. 79; to Bergquist; [James Bergquist, Newton, Mass. (2007-2009; sold to MIA)
signed: ULC, in the print: [(symbol) 1510 (symbol) / A D]
title: The Penitent
